intro: Elatostema brunneinerve, commonly known as the brown-veined Elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The leaves often have a distinctive brownish venation pattern, which gives the plant its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often overlooked due to their modest appearance.
